body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!-->


**What happened**: When running e2e conformance tests against a `v1.13.2` cluster using a public HTTPS endpoint for the apiserver, you get the following errors:

```
• Failure [270.975 seconds]
[k8s.io] Pods
/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:694
  should support retrieving logs from the container over websockets [NodeConformance] [Conformance] [It]
  /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/framework/framework.go:699

  Jan 17 19:59:43.264: Failed to open websocket to ws://my-apiserver.example.com:80/api/v1/namespaces/e2e-tests-pods-z49g5/pods/pod-logs-websocket-cdc21ea5-1a91-11e9-9465-0242ac110002/log?container=main: websocket.Dial ws://my-apiserver.example.com:80/api/v1/namespaces/e2e-tests-pods-z49g5/pods/pod-logs-websocket-cdc21ea5-1a91-11e9-9465-0242ac110002/log?container=main: dial tcp 3.x.x.x:80: connect: connection timed out

  /go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/_output/local/go/src/k8s.io/kubernetes/test/e2e/common/pods.go:598
------------------------------
Jan 17 19:59:43.470: INFO: Running AfterSuite actions on all nodes
```

**What you expected to happen**:

The API server endpoint is `https://my-apiserver.example.com` so the e2e tests should use `wss://` and connect on port `443` instead of `80`.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**: Run e2e conformance tests against a cluster with the apiserver exposed on a public endpoint with a public CA.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

When looking at the code here: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5e86fa43f59f8ed4fd353ab17dc1e65708a9ae71/test/e2e/common/pods.go#L563-L618

It looks like the tlsConfig is not correctly derived from the URL. Diving into `framework.OpenWebSocketForURL` I see that this uses `TLSConfigFor` deep down:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5e86fa43f59f8ed4fd353ab17dc1e65708a9ae71/staging/src/k8s.io/client-go/transport/transport.go#L53-L116

And this seem to return `nil` unless the kubeconfig has a CA or other explicit TLS config configured: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5e86fa43f59f8ed4fd353ab17dc1e65708a9ae71/staging/src/k8s.io/client-go/transport/transport.go#L56

I believe if this check also checked the `scheme` of the URL, then it would be correct: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/5e86fa43f59f8ed4fd353ab17dc1e65708a9ae71/test/e2e/framework/util.go#L4399

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

labels.name: kind/bug

title: e2e: Websocket tests not working with HTTPS endpoint using public CA
